meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek or Roman shoe with a high sole.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see a pair of cothurnus displayed alongside other ancient footwear.
meanings.sent2: The actor wore cothurnus during the play to give him extra height on stage.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist found a perfectly preserved cothurnus, but it was too big for anyone to wear!
meanings.sent4: Her cothurnus of confidence made her stand tall and proud in front of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The cobblestone streets echoed with the clack of the actor's cothurnus as he walked to the theater.

meanings.definition: A type of high, thick-soled boot worn by actors in ancient Greek tragedies.
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the actors' cothurnus added a dramatic flair to their costumes.
meanings.sent2: The costume designer meticulously crafted each cothurnus to match the characters' personalities.
meanings.sent3: The actors joked that their cothurnus were so heavy, they felt like they were walking on stilts!
meanings.sent4: The cothurnus of tradition passed down through generations of actors, symbolizing their dedication to the craft.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight illuminated the actor's cothurnus, emphasizing the grandeur of the tragic scene.
